intro: Bryonia trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by orange, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed, typically with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Bryonia trilobata is known for its toxic properties, with all parts of the plant containing harmful compounds.
